peopleAlsoAsk.question: How do I find out the value of my antique furniture?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: The best way to determine its worth is to bring it to a professional antique furniture appraiser who has specific knowledge of antique furniture pieces and knows all the period, material and style details that impact its value.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: How Much is Your Antique Furniture Worth? | Appraisal Guide

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How much does it cost to get furniture appraised?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Typically, formal appraisals for a single item start at about $250 to $350. Additional items will typically add incremental costs of between $25 and $100 per item. The exact amount depends on their rarity, uniqueness, and the ability to find appropriate comparable properties to appraise them.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: What Appraisals Cost

peopleAlsoAsk.question: What is the best way to sell antique furniture?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet:
DECIDING WHERE TO SELL YOUR FURNITURE
1
Take your pieces to an antique store. ...
2
Put your items up for sale online. ...
3
Submit your antiques to an auction house. ...
4
Sell your pieces to a friend or relative who has had their eye on them. ...
5
Offload your items quickly at a thrift store, flea market, or garage sale.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: 3 Easy Ways to Sell Antique Furniture - wikiHow

peopleAlsoAsk.question: Is there such a thing as a furniture appraiser?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Appraisers also consider the market conditions and the trends in the industry to determine the current market value of the furniture being appraised. Professional furniture appraisers have extensive experience and knowledge and are certified by a professional appraisal association.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: What to Expect From a Professional Furniture Appraisal - AppraiseItNow
